byline.contributor: Nick Madigan, D.J. Wilson and Yamiche Alcindor contributed reporting.

abstract: Young African-Americans are increasingly challenging long-held policy positions on crime and welfare established during Clinton White House, despite fact that many of their parents supported such changes at time; difference of opinion highlights generational divide in black families regarding political activism and could have some impact on presidential election.

headline.print_headline: On Crime Bill and the Clintons, Young Blacks Clash With Parents
headline.main: On Crime Bill and the Clintons, Young Blacks Clash With Parents

snippet: Young African-Americans are challenging Clinton-era policies on crime, diverging from their elders who enthusiastically support Hillary Clinton and the former president.
lead_paragraph: Young African-Americans are challenging Clinton-era policies on crime, diverging from their elders who enthusiastically support Hillary Clinton and the former president.
